issues.title: Overwriting changes made on zeronet by syncing from Wikipedia.org?
issues.body:
Hello,

You may need solve the issue where zeronet users edit a zeronet based wiki article and then a few days after, other user do synchronization from wikipedia.org and overwrite their work.

Maybe not allowing to edit synced articles at all? Do not know.

issues.title: Apostrophe results in wrong link
issues.body:
Hello,

[here](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1KiwiBCVBUcuypVm8FEmUW9YT6fJDXkN9r/?/imported/en/https-en-wikipedia-org-wiki-mao-zedong/mao-zedong) in first sentence is text "People's Republic of China", but the link under it is wrong (because of apostrophe) when comparing to [original wikipedia article](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mao_Zedong).

issues.title: Large article loading slow and is CPU intensive
issues.body:
Hello,

following article is quite large and on my Core i3 is loading 10 seconds around and during the time the CPU is maxed to 100%.

http://127.0.0.1:43110/1KiwiBCVBUcuypVm8FEmUW9YT6fJDXkN9r/?/imported/en/https-en-wikipedia-org-wiki-venezuela/venezuela

issues.title: User friendly URLs
issues.body:
It may be handy if users can use very short URLs when linking to article and if it would contain only a article name, so it is user friendly and short.

But some articles was already linked from external sites, so if would be possible to keep old URLs working.
